column4: anyone know a good wireless card that i can pick up at bestbuy?
expresscard for my Dell laptop
the built in dell wifi uses the restricted drivers and they're not compatible with RT
i know orinoco supposedly makes good cards
just want to be able to waltz down to BB and pick one up
we don't know the sortiment of bestbuy
why don't you order one on the internet ? :)
cuz that takes time, i want to be able to just walk into best buy in like 10 minutes when i leave work and just get one
yeah i know, that takes time :)
everyone needs time to buy things and if you want to make sure it works, you have to invest that time
yeah or i could ask to see if anyone else has invested that time and reap the benefits of their time
and i you do it long enough you'll have wasted more time than you would have just seeing for yourself
no, the issue is transportation time, so this could potentially save me hours of time
so you live a few hundred miles away from bestbuy?

may wanna check this out, seems to be supported, and it's best buy, but no guarantee they have it in their showcase :) http://www.bestbuy.com/site/D-Link+-+Extreme-N+ExpressCard+for+Most+PC+Laptops/9809841.p?id=1218177168066&skuId=9809841&st=wireless%20card&cp=1&lp=15
it'S a d-link dwa 643
how do you know it's supported? where did you find the data on that?
google it
it√Ñs listed as compatible on madwifi site
yeah i guess so... it's not that expensive, so i guess it's worth a shot
so madwifi comes with ubuntu?
as in, after the install process i won't have to anything to get wifi up?
don't know, but you could buy it and try it, if it doesn't work out of the box you can always bring it back and settle for another card
